title: UTF-8 error unwrap when building project

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
Trying to build a small project of mine I got a panic in the compiler. Interestingly enough, I built it first by sending the project through SCP from my computer to the test server where I was going to compile it, but I saw that I was sending the compiled rlibs so I stopped the transmission, probably corrupting the files. When I ran `cargo build` the compiler panicked. I then ran `cargo clean` and `cargo build` worked as expected, so I can no longer reproduce the issue :/

## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:

```
rustc 1.15.1 (021bd294c 2017-02-08)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 021bd294c039bd54aa5c4aa85bcdffb0d24bc892
commit-date: 2017-02-08
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.15.1
LLVM version: 3.9
```

Backtrace:
Sadly I ran `cargo clean` before runing with backtrace and since then I cannot reproduce the issue. This is the output of the build, though:

```
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Utf8Error { valid_up_to: 19 }', /buildslave/rust-buildbot/slave/stable-dist-rustc-linux/build/src/libcore/result.rs:837
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.

error: Could not compile `regex_tester`.
```
